title: Kingslayers - IWDominate and Team Liquid take down TSM

replies.body: They didnt deserve the win tho, not saying TSM did ether but im sorry, if you hold off a team that has 4 5 dragon buffs and 3 baron buffs, im sorry you dont deserve to win and the fact that they won through a back door, is really sad.
What? Who deserved to win then? TSM suck pretty much the whole game. WT did some good things to stall, but TSM as a whole was crap. TSM fanboys will never learn...

Really? "Fanboys" A bit childish and petty? TSM had a few slip ups early game which caused them to fall into their base. TL still played great and was an amazing game to watch. Just enjoy the game for what it is and dont get so bitchy over it. You have a TL icon.....does that make you a "fanboy"?......Dont act like a kid dude -_-
Not fanboys, but boy fans.

Regardless of what the first 45 minutes or so will tell you, it's more that TSM lost the game, than Liquid winning it. TSM was in control at the end. Liquid had all the buffs in the world; 5 dragons, baron, red/blue buff, all 3 lanes of baron-buffed super-minions... and couldn't finish the game. Not only was TSM winning those teamfights at the end, they were winning them CONVINCINGLY, often losing just one guy for an ace.

TSM needed to wait til that top inhib respawned so that the Nexus was invulnerable and couldn't be backdoored. One more ace would have seriously swung the game, because with no super-minions pushing into the base, TSM would be free to take at least 1 inhib from Liquid with the death timers being that long.

I don't know whether they felt greedy, or forgot about Rek'Sai's ult, but TSM made that crucial mistake of sending too many people out of base to get baron. The only thing Liquid did that "won" the game.. was take advantage of a TSM mistake.

That is absolute and utter bull****. TSM had practically no control over any objective throughout the game. Mainly due to TL's vision game and crucial out-rotations and ganks. They were able to put a good fight at the end, yes, but that was because jinx is a late-game monster, and TL's team didn't scale particularly well at all: it was a mid game comp. And they won the mid game so hard, that they could afford to have a much inferior late-game comp. TSM got outplayed this time, regardless of them being a much better team in general.
so if you won a game back dooring the team you are playing means you dont deserve it?
The team that won is the team that deserves to win. That's how the game works.

Then TSM deserve to win? Why the team that can't destroy enemy's Nexus deserve to win?

TL can destroy enemy's Nexus, they deserve to win.

They took ONE very CLOSE game off of TSM and now they're "King slayers" I understand the only purpose of the title is to grab attention, but this wasn't even a high profile game with TSM on a massive winning streak. A loss is a loss, but this article makes it sound like they won NA or something lol. Not to mention, the end of the game was anything, but smooth. This article just feels over the top for me. Hell, if Coast beast TSM I bet the article would call them "King Slayers" as well...

Yeah. Idk what you're on about, wouldn't you feel accomplished if you took out the number one team in the LCS/Region? That's why they're called KingSlayers in this article. Because it is a great accomplishment. It doesn't matter if the ending wasn't smooth because as the article said they methodically took all three inhibitors. That means they outplayed them on the entire map prior to their end game team fight blunders. Cool Wildturtle got a penta, Cool Dyrus ninja'd the second Penta. It was entertaining man, if you don't right an upbeat article about a team giving TSM their first loss of the season what do you write an article about then? People will always find something to complain about and my god, it's annoying.
Shoudnt it be 8-1?
They record exactly what people say.

I don't think it's fair to say that TSM leaving the base was a mistake, necessarily. Yes, it resulted in their loss, but in the position they were in, it was either make their move or stand next to the Winions as they slam the nexus.  The game was lost so much earlier than that; they weren't able to take any objectives, and Liquid starved them out. Their real mistake was letting that happen in the first place.

Sure, Liquid won, they deserved it, whatever. I'm more annoyed with how this article portrays the victory like Dominate and Liquid did something amazing to win. They had the better early game, got objectives, and then couldn't end the game with like 7 dragons and 3 barons. They won in the end, but it was nothing spectacular. 

The fact that this article even exists, like Liquid did some spectacular feat, just hurts my brain.
Wow, I read these comments and wonder, do people look at turret counts? anyone? Hello? Liquid won that game, almost dropped it (possibly, maybe) but they won that game.

Liquid knew that they couldn't take TSM 1 on 1. So they took every possible buff and advantage they could get. Liquid made sure to play dragons and baron just perfectly. It was a smart match and they deserved to win.
It didn't matter how many dragons and barons Liquid got, they still were unable to finish the game that way. The only reason Liquid won was because of a backdoor Rek'Sai ultimate.

TSM fanboys once again can't admit that they got beaten .... Thats one of the reasons why I hate TSM because of their fanbase. 

I prefer CLG, C9 and TL more than TSM.
Thanks for the spoiler in the subject title, asshole OP.
And why does the date say Mon 2/23 o.o....Time travel confirmed

Still got aced twice tho lol
It was hard but TL played well :P
